item.title: HTML Structure
item.description: Front page of a newspaper Which elements stand out and why? What would happen if every word was the same size font? Structure helps readers better understand the stories written in the newspaper Word document HTML document The above all have something in common - they are all documents The same principles that apply to newspapers and documents also apply to html pages

item.title: HTML Tag Anatomy
item.description: What is a Tag? Tags act like containers, they tell the browser what type of information lies between (aka the content) the opening and closing tag Opening Tag comprised of character(s) surrounded by less than and equal than signs (brackets) characters within the brackets indicates the tags purpose Closing Tag Same as opening tag except closing tag contains a forward slash which informs browser that element has ended Terms “tags” and “elements” are often used interchangeably

item.title: HTML Attributes
item.description: What is an HTML Attribute? Attributes provide additional information about the contents of the an element. They are placed in the opening tag They have two parts: name, value Attribute Structure Attribute Name Indicates what kind of extra information you are supplying to the browser about the content in the element characters within the brackets indicates the tags purpose Attribute Value

item.title: Tag Overview
Empty Elements
item.description: What are Empty Elements? Empty elements are elements that do not have a closing tag <!-- p tags are NOT empty elements because they have a closing tag ("</p>") --> <p> I am not an empty element </p> <!-- img tags are considered empty elements because they DO NOT have a closing tag --> <img src="images/team_hands" alt="a group of people touching hands in a star formation" title="teamwork is awesome"> Empty elements cannot contain child elements (i.
